discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The Targeted Release channel is a feature in Microsoft 365 that allows users to receive early access to new features and updates before they are rolled out to the general public.

Answer is: A

The underlined segment states that subscribing to the Targeted release channel will ensure that workers can install new Microsoft Word features as soon as they become available. This statement is accurate.

The Targeted release channel is a program that allows users to access new features in Microsoft 365 applications before they are released to the general public. By subscribing to this channel, users can test new features and provide feedback to Microsoft before they are released to everyone.

Therefore, if a company wants its workers to have access to new Word features as soon as they become available, subscribing to the Targeted release channel is a good option.

comments.content:
B. Standard release: This is the default update channel for Microsoft 365 and it includes all new features and updates that have been tested and validated by Microsoft.

C. Semi-annual: This is a slower update channel that releases new features and updates every six months. It's intended for organizations that want to adopt new features more slowly and have more time to test them.

D. Annual: This is the slowest update channel, with new features and updates released once a year. It's intended for organizations that prioritize stability and do not want to adopt new features quickly.

Upgrade all devices to Windows 10: Windows 7 is no longer supported, and Windows 10 provides better integration with Office 365 ProPlus, ensuring compatibility and access to the latest features.

Deploy policies using Microsoft Intune: Microsoft Intune is a cloud-based device management solution that allows for centralized policy enforcement.
